reviews.review:
Yess this game is really cool. Best puzzle game in like ever! 1st game was okay but this game just introduced so many elements of puzzle. And Valve.. the absolute astoundished reaction on my face when I loaded this game with my crappy 5 year old laptop.. with 60 FPS???!?!? That's insane! And the graphics looked so good! These dudes are the best game developers in optimizing game experience... I'll pay $40 for Portal 3 I swear lol!

Best. Puzzle. Game. Ever.
Great game and I really enjoy! One of the best games I've played in a long time!
Played this with ya bois through the co-op campaign.  The co-op is worth the entire price of the game.  It runs on just about every system that isn't 15 years old.  Why don't you already have this?
The game is really great and entertaining, especially for co-op. It took us a while to finish all levels, some were really tricky!
simplesmente incrível, da uma puta nostalgia jogar esse jogo de novo anos depois.
очень класная игра хоть мой ноут еще тот тостер но я прохожу ету игру с удовольствием

The campaign made me cry at the end when i was a kid. 
So many easter eggs and a hidden story.
Got the platinum for the game because its the best. 
Coop is also the funnest thing ever to play with another friend.

Thats all you need to know
very good and very challenging for ones mind
i have nothing i can add. this game is a masterpiece in my eyes.
One of the best games ever created. This one needs no introduction, the singleplayer and co-op offerings are simply perfect.

I had just finished this game, and let me tell you, IT IS AMAZING! It is way better than the first game, there is a lot more backstory for Glados, lore, and more fun gameplay!
This game is literally as close to perfect as you can get.
flying through portals while you break the fourth wall and shout "PoTaToE bAtTeRiEs"

An absolute masterpiece!
The single player's plot is very well made and the dialogues are super funny and intelligent.
The multiplayer is also very fun playing with a friend.
Finally, the level editor in-game makes this game age well and evolve with the community.
It's 5 stars from me :)

Great Game love the mechanics, Characters, physics, ect. and the story is way longer than Portal, and there is even multi player, Portal didn't have that. I'm only half the way in the story and its all ready been a day, i beat portal in 3 hours!

One of my favourite games of all time. 100% recommend it.

I liked this game because of the many creative mechanics you use during your game play. I just wish in the test chamber creator, you could change the theme to old and rustic, stuff like that. I would also like cat walks and I want to make it so the player can go outside of the map to get an item like in the actual game.

It's a better presented product than it's predecessor and a great game overall, but I found chapter 5,6, and 7 to be an  unnecessary slog.  I was relieved to finally get back to the test chambers in chapter 8.

Fue a finales del 2016 que adquirí el pack de Valve y, literalmente, no jugué ninguno de sus títulos más conocidos hasta este caótico año. Comencé en noviembre con el primer Portal y, a los pocos días de haber terminado, me decidí a jugar este juego el cual considero magnífico. 

Me encantan los dos juegos por igual, debo decirlo, pero Portal 2 posee una historia un poco más profunda, que se puntualiza y se vuelve aun más magnífica cuando parte de tu camino se convierte en (sin quererlo) una revisión del pasado de Aperture Science. 

Otra cosa que me gustaría resaltar es que, en grandes rasgos, este juego posee el apartado para jugar en cooperativo (el cual tiene pocos mapas, a mi gusto) y que abre puertas a los mapas creados por la comunidad permitiendo que éste sea renovado cada vez que sea posible.

I will admit that, despite playing this game on a since lost Steam account about 5 years ago, I was never a huge Portal fan. I enjoyed it for sure, but it didn't quite stick with me.

However, 5 years later, I can say with confidence that this game has aged like a fine wine. I got the rare opportunity to play Portal like it was new to me, and it's been incredible. The game is the perfect mix of all the right ingredients. The levels are unique, fun, and just the right amount of challenging, and the game has some incredible environments. They all ooze atmosphere, and certain areas feel very grand. It makes you wish the game was a bit more open.

Of course, I can't talk about Portal without mentioning it's incredible story and characters. The way this game manages to have it's own great self-contained story while also managing to tie itself back to another incredible series from Valve is just awesome to me. The characters in this game, as you would expect, are incredibly charming and funny. I usually get extremely bored listening to characters in games, even ones I like, but while playing Portal 2, I was actually sad when they stopped. I would even stop just to listen to Cave Johnson's pre-recorded messages. The writing in this game is top notch.

If I had to complain about anything, and this is really just a minor thing, it's that it's too short. You can finish story mode in about 2 hours (which I have managed to stretch into 6), and I was genuinely sad when I found out that I don't have much left to do. However, the game has plenty of bonus content, including community test chambers, co-op, and community mods. I don't think I'll be dropping this game any time soon.

If you haven't played this incredible game, now is the best time. You would be dishonoring yourself if you did not play this game.
Нихуя не понятно, но очень интересно
when you get stuck on a puzzle it can be frustrating, but that just makes it so much more satisfying when you finally figure it out

i just finished playing this game and i can say with certainty that this is one of the if not the best games i have ever played. I find as a game dev myself the whole portal concept is very well done and interesting. I also really like the story. 5 stars, Would recommend.
